intro: Sisyrinchium oxyspathum, commonly known as the narrowleaf blue-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like leaves and showy blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It produces small, tuberous roots and has a compact, clump-forming growth habit. Sisyrinchium oxyspathum is often found in USDA hardiness zones 4 through 8, thriving in well-drained soils.
